I‚Äôm struggling too with my whole routine being flipped.
Start a routine if you can, at least during the week.

Wake up / bed time (alarm if necessary)

A workout routine - even something simple, push ups, squats, lunges & crunches 3x a week

Try some sort of learning, a book, youtube, or if you‚Äôre studying, do your uni/school work.

Eat healthy too! If you‚Äôre inside, you‚Äôll probably be prone to eating out of boredom.


Goodluck! Hope this helps

Just because you quit anti depressants, doesn‚Äôt necessarily mean that you‚Äôre where you wanna be.
It sounds like they did their job?

Please Don‚Äôt hurt yourself, it doesn‚Äôt achieve any positive outcome.

For me, quitting antidepressants allowed me to be emotional again rather than being flat/numb, 80% of the time and 20% an emotional roller coaster ( I was pretty angry at one point too). I‚Äôve taken the approach that medication isn‚Äôt the be all & end all. It‚Äôs hard at first and when you find your feet is up to you.

I started going to the gym, eating healthy, I enrolled into university, I‚Äôm trying to keep to myself & develop myself. It genuinely helps to focus on you & what you want in life. Maybe this approach isn‚Äôt for you.
I guess a major issue for people is the lack of control in there life (myself included) & retaking that can be hard. Slow but steady!

Chin up

Lol waited 13 minutes to get into a lobby & am still waiting for the Fire team players to join. 

Wow, First impressions aren‚Äôt great.

Get out of the house. Do something to occupy your mind. Go for a walk or anything. These feelings will pass, You have a lot more yet to offer to this world.

If these feelings persist call a helpline, these are usually found by a quick google search. Alternatively you can call a friend or a loved one.

If you still can‚Äôt cope, call emergency services & let them know you‚Äôre in a crisis and need support asap.

Don‚Äôt give up.

Unfortunately. Ive Been in a similar position before. Just try and stay motivated. Push yourself outside of your comfort zone. 

It‚Äôs hard af sometimes but you got this!

If you can, I think you should make an appointment with a Doctor / Therapist. When you feel comfortable with the the Doc/therapist or even a friend, you could get them to sit with you family/parents and explain the situation if you don‚Äôt think you‚Äôd be comfortable to.

I can understand where you‚Äôre coming from. You don‚Äôt want to burden them with your problems. Just getting it off your chest will help so much. They do care & will help, if you let them.

Yeah okay.

Have you spoken to anyone about it? Doctor, friend, counselor? 

It seems like this has been going on for a while.

You think you may have depression? 

It‚Äôs fairly normal to at one point or another suffer symptoms of depression based on a number of factors. This doesn‚Äôt mean you are diagnosable. 

How long have these feelings been going on for?

Sorry to hear.

You should Go gym or do something out of the house. Try & Clear your mind. you got this.

Mhm. You need to get into gear. In my experience it‚Äôs easy to chill & do nothing.

The gym is really good for me, plus nutrition. Something I know has a positive impact on physical well-being which helps my mental wellbeing. But exercise/sport makes physical changes & helps with depression.

Start doing things for yourself. Be who you want to be. Do what you want to do. You need to find a passion/goal to strive for.

You‚Äôre only a prisoner to yourself. 
If you want change you need to initiate it.

You may get given the tools and tips to succeed, but without trying you‚Äôll never get anywhere.

Start small, push yourself - day by day even. Even if it‚Äôs hard or tedious. The most rewarding things in life are. You can‚Äôt escape without trying!

Goodluck ;

Getting ghosted sucks. It‚Äôs kinda a kick in the self-esteem but I wouldn‚Äôt read too much into it. 
Easier said than done.

Focus on your self-worth, because you will attract the energy you give off.

It‚Äôs fair & understandable. From the way you describe the situation.

If he isn‚Äôt addressing the issues or making an effort to help himself, it‚Äôs going to be fruitless to try & make things work as a couple. I believe you may need to make it very clear if you haven‚Äôt already how you feel. It may change something for him. 

Honesty is the biggest thing, at least for me.

Yeah I know it‚Äôs not easy.  You don‚Äôt have to do anything crazy, start small. 
Even if its;
folding your washing for 10mins once a day. Set a timer & do it. 
Or going to the gym once a day.
Or not eating takeout.

Reasonable, achievable goals that you can stick to.

Little things add up, give yourself some purpose. Volunteering is another good way.

Hope it helps!

Time heals things pretty well if you make an effort. I suppose the issue with depression etc is that its a cycle. To break that cycle you have to challenge yourself & endure the shit for a while before you see any results. 

Take care of yourself & try and eat healthier. Healthy body & healthy mind. Self love is more important than you realise.
